alert.note: Alert for Chaves (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albuquerque (Northern and Central New Mexico)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued August 21 at 1:31PM MDT until further notice by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Albuquerque NM has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in New Mexico... Pecos River Near Lake Arthur affecting Chaves County. ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM MONDAY MORNING UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE... * WHAT...Moderate flooding is forecast. This approaches the flood of record. Major flooding is possible. * WHERE...Pecos River near Lake Arthur. * WHEN...From Monday morning until further notice. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 12:15 PM MDT Sunday the stage was 9.4 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage tomorrow morning to a crest of 22.3 feet early tomorrow afternoon. It will then fall below flood stage tomorrow afternoon. - Flood stage is 20.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 21.9 feet on 09/24/1941. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: To escape rising water, take the shortest path to higher ground. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/abq. The next statement will be issued late tonight around 145 AM MDT.
